meanings.sent1: She kept misassaying the math problems, getting all the answers wrong.
meanings.sent2: The scientist realized he was misassaying the data after double-checking his calculations.
meanings.sent3: The detective's misassaying of the evidence led to the wrong suspect being arrested.
meanings.sent4: Her misassaying of his intentions caused unnecessary misunderstandings between them.
meanings.sent5: Misassaying the recipe ingredients resulted in a disastrous cake that no one wanted to eat.

meanings.sent1: The misassaying of the situation led to a lot of confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent2: His misassaying of her feelings caused unnecessary tension in their relationship.
meanings.sent3: The misassaying of the weather forecast made everyone bring umbrellas on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The misassaying of the painting's value resulted in it being sold for much less than it was worth.
meanings.sent5: The misassaying of the test results caused panic among the students until the error was corrected.
